intro: Amsinckia intactilis, commonly known as the desert parsley, is a flowering plant native to the western United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that resemble small daisies. The plant has finely divided, fern-like leaves and produces yellow flowers that bloom in early spring. It thrives in arid environments and is adapted to withstand drought conditions. Amsinckia intactilis is also known for its aromatic foliage and is sometimes used in traditional herbal remedies.
